description: JSON Schema for a Mason root document. See: https://github.com/JornWildt/Mason/blob/master/Documentation/Mason-draft-2.md

.*.title: Mason control
.*.description: Property name must be either a standard link relation (e.g. "self", "up", "prev", "next"), a fully-qualified URL pointing to documentation for the relation, or a Mason curie resolvable to a URL that points to such documentation.

href.description: Hypermedia reference - a URI or URI template.

isHrefTemplate.description: Boolean indicating whether "href" is a URI template or concrete URI (default values is false).

method.description: HTTP method to use, e.g. GET, POST

encoding.description: Required encoding of data in request body.

jsonFile.description: Name of property that contains the JSON data (only applicable if encoding is 'json+files')

schema.description: Embedded schema definition of request body and href template parameters.

schemaUrl.description: URL to referenced schema definition of request body and href template parameters.

output.description: List of possible returned media types.

files.description: List of parts definition for multipart requests.

name.description: URL prefix where descriptions of link relations are found

@id.description: Unique identifier for later reference to the situation that resulted in a error condition (for instance when looking up a log entry).

@code.description: Code describing the error condition in general.

@messages.description: Array of additional human readable error messages.

@details.description: Extensive human readable message directed at the client developer.

@httpStatusCode.description: HTTP status code from the latest response.

@time.description: Date in the format defined by RFC 3339. Example: "1985-04-12T23:20:50.52Z". It should contain a timestamp of when the error occurred.
